name: api_activity
description: API events describe general CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) API activities, e.g. (AWS Cloudtrail)
caption: API Activity

time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.
time.caption: Event Time

src_endpoint.description: Details about the source of the activity.
src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint

3.description: The API call in the event pertains to a 'update' activity.
3.caption: Update

1.description: The API call in the event pertains to a 'create' activity.
1.caption: Create

2.description: The API call in the event pertains to a 'read' activity.
2.caption: Read

99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

4.description: The API call in the event pertains to a 'delete' activity.
4.caption: Delete

activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.
activity_id.caption: Activity ID

metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.
metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.name: metadata

version.description: The version of the OCSF schema, using Semantic Versioning Specification (SemVer). For example: 1.0.0. Event consumers use the version to determine the available event attributes.
version.caption: Version

product.description: The product that reported the event.
product.caption: Product

600303.description: The API call in the event pertains to a 'update' activity.
600303.caption: API Activity: Update

600301.description: The API call in the event pertains to a 'create' activity.
600301.caption: API Activity: Create

600302.description: The API call in the event pertains to a 'read' activity.
600302.caption: API Activity: Read

600304.description: The API call in the event pertains to a 'delete' activity.
600304.caption: API Activity: Delete

type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.
type_uid.caption: Type ID

actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.
actor.caption: Actor

process.description: The process that initiated the activity.
process.caption: Process

session.description: The user session from which the activity was initiated.
session.caption: Session

user.description: The user that initiated the activity or the user context from which the activity was initiated.
user.caption: User

app_name.description: The client application or service that initiated the activity. This can be in conjunction with the user if present. Note that app_name is distinct from the process if present.
app_name.caption: Application Name

app_uid.description: The unique identifier of the client application or service that initiated the activity. This can be in conjunction with the user if present. Note that app_name is distinct from the process.pid or process.uid if present.
app_uid.caption: Application ID

invoked_by.description: The name of the service that invoked the activity as described in the event.
invoked_by.caption: Invoked by

actor.name: actor

cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.
cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.name: cloud

provider.description: The unique name of the Cloud services provider, such as AWS, MS Azure, GCP, etc.
provider.caption: Provider

6003.description: API events describe general CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) API activities, e.g. (AWS Cloudtrail)
6003.caption: API Activity

class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.
class_uid.caption: Class ID

api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.
api.caption: API Details
api.name: api

3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.
3.caption: Medium

6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.
6.caption: Fatal

2.description: The user decides if action is needed.
2.caption: Low

99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.
5.caption: Critical

severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.
severity_id.caption: Severity ID

osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.
osint.caption: OSINT

value.description: The actual indicator value in scope, e.g., a SHA-256 hash hexdigest or a domain name.
value.caption: Indicator

6.description: A User Agent typically seen in HTTP request headers.
6.caption: User Agent

0.description: The indicator type is ambiguous or there is not a related indicator for the OSINT object.
0.caption: Unknown

2.description: A full-qualified domain name (FQDN), subdomain, or partial domain.
2.caption: Domain

99.description: The indicator type is not directly listed.
99.caption: Other

4.description: Any type of hash e.g., MD5, SHA1, SHA2, BLAKE, BLAKE2, etc. generated from a file, malware sample, request header, or otherwise.
4.caption: Hash

5.description: A Uniform Resource Locator (URL) or Uniform Resource Indicator (URI).
5.caption: URL

7.description: The serial number, fingerprint, or full content of an X.509 digital certificate.
7.caption: Digital Certificate

8.description: The contents of an email or any related information to an email object.
8.caption: Email

10.description: A CVE ID, CWE ID, or other identifier for a weakness, exploit, bug, or misconfiguration.
10.caption: Vulnerability

uid.description: The unique identifier of the entity.
uid.caption: Unique ID

osint.name: osint

6.description: Application Activity events report detailed information about the behavior of applications and services.
6.caption: Application Activity

category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.
category_uid.caption: Category ID
